sources.title: This is the Army (1943) IRVING BERLIN MUSICAL
sources.description:
GOD BLESS IRVING BERLIN
Director: Michael Curtiz
Stars: Ronald Reagan, Alan Hale, George Murphy, Joe Louis
Composer: Irving Berlin

In this Patriotic Musical Extravaganza, Ronald Reagan stars as Private Johnny Jones, the son of a famous choreographer, who is assigned to create a new all-soldier show for Broadway.  He not only has to live up to his dad’s reputation but has to fend off his fiancé, who is ready for marriage. 

SONGS
"It's Your Country and My Country" Sung by Gertrude Niesen
"My Sweetie" Sung by George Murphy
"Poor Little Me, I’m on KP" Sung by George Tobias
"We're On Our Way to France" Sung by George Murphy
"Goodbye, France" Sung by Chorus
"God Bless America" Sung by Kate Smith
"What Does He Look Like" Sung by Frances Langford
"This Is The Army, Mr. Jones" Sung by Sydney Robin, William Roerick, Henry Jones
"I'm Getting Tired So I Can Sleep" Sung by James Burrell
"Mandy" Sung by Ralph Magelssen
"Ladies of the Chorus" Sung by Alan Hale
"That's What the Well-Dressed Man in Harlem Will Wear" Sung by Chorus
"How About a Cheer for the Navy" Sung by Chorus
"I Left My Heart at the Stage Door Canteen" Sung by Earl Oxford
"With My Head in the Clouds/American Eagles" Sung by Robert Shanley
"Oh, How I Hate to Get Up in the Morning" Sung by Irving Berlin 
"This Time" Sung by Robert Shanley

sources.title: This Is the Army (1943)
sources.description: In WW I dancer Jerry Jones stages an all-soldier show on Broadway, called Yip Yip Yaphank. Wounded in the War, he becomes a producer. In WW II his son Johnny Jones, who was before his fathers assistant, gets the order to stage a knew all-soldier show, called THIS IS THE ARMY. But in his pesonal life he has problems, because he refuses to marry his fiancée until the war is over. Watch on RetroFlix:  https://retroflix.org/this-is-the-army-1943/

sources.title: This is the Army
sources.description: Dancer Jerry Jones (George Murphy) is wounded in World War I and finding his showbiz options limited becomes a producer. 25 years later, he puts on an all-soldier revue jampacked with Irving Berlin songs. Includes Kate Smith singing "God Bless America" and a brief appearance by boxing legend Joe Louis.

sources.title: This is the Army

metadata.Plot: In WWI dancer Jerry Jones stages an all-soldier show on Broadway, called Yip Yip Yaphank. Wounded in the war, he becomes a producer. In WWII his son Johnny Jones, who was before his father's assistant, gets the order to stage a new all-soldier show, called This is the Army. But in his personal life he has problems, because he refuses to marry his fiancée until the war is over.
metadata.Writer: Casey Robinson, Claude Binyon, Irving Berlin
metadata.Actors: George Murphy, Joan Leslie, George Tobias
